oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tate Spring Hotel advertisement
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tate Spring Hotel advertisement with illustration of building. Source and date unknown.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hotels; Springs; Resorts; Advertisements;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tate Spring Hotel Tate Spring Tenn. Rates reasonable. Booklet sent upon request See Route 997 and Note (b) Route 640 Modern hotel and cottages. Golf, Tennis, Horseback Biding, Dancing and other Amusements. Tate Spring Natural Mineral Water, which is highly recommended for stomach, liver, kidney and intestinal trouble, shipped everywhere. Located at junction of Lee Highway, running from Gettysburg to New Orleans and the Boone Trail Highway, which is a branch of the Dixie Highway. Twelve miles north of Morristown. Forty miles northeast of Knoxville. Ninety miles northwest of Ashe- ville.
